result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:33 AM Defendant Darrius L Turner in court, in custody.  Attorney Nicholas M Weege in court for Darrius L Turner.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Michael Thurston in court for State of Wisconsin.
 
City of Delafield police officer Kimberly Kuehl sworn and testified on direct by Atty. Thurston.  Cross examination by Atty. Weege.  State rests.  Testimony closed.  Atty. Thurston moves for bind over.  Atty. Weege objects.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for January 5, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Warrant signed by Judge Bohren cancelled on October 26, 2022.
Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victims A and B listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed.
Preliminary hearing on November 4, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference on November 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Notice Regarding United States Passport For Criminal Defendant

Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim A and B listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed.
The original document was titled: Proposed Protective Order
The original history event date is: 10-26-2022

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. 
 Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court.  If defendant has a passport, defendant to surrender their passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) within 24 hours of release from custody.  Defendant is not permitted to apply for the issuance,  duplicate nor renewal of a passport and/or passport card during the pendency of this action. Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Victim B/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim A/Victim B listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 1 mile of Victim A/Victim B, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

1:29 PM Defendant Darrius L Turner in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen Jr. in court for Darrius L Turner.  Attorney appears as friend of the court.   Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M Jay in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was not evaluated by the public defender's office.   Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Attorney Jensen provides arguments as to probable cause within the criminal complaint.  State presents arguments in support of probable cause.  For all the reasons stated on the record, the Court denies the request and does find probable cause for today's purposes.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
